job_titles: Unilever's Internship Exploration Day: Kickstart your career!
job_description:
Unilever's Internship Exploration Day: Kickstart your career!
Locatie: Hofplein, Rotterdam
Voltijd
Lokale voorwaarden zijn van toepassing
DUTCH
Unilever's Internship Exploration Day: Kickstart Your Career!
Ben je geïnteresseerd in een stage in Marketing, Supply Chain of Customer Development bij Unilever? En wil je eind augustus/begin september aan je stage beginnen? Dan is dit het evenement voor jou!
A better business. A better world. A better you.
Unilever is een wereldwijd Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) bedrijf met meer dan 400 merken en 168.000 medewerkers die actief zijn in meer dan 190 landen, met een omzet van 60 miljard. Onze merken (Waaronder Ben & Jerry's, Knorr, Dove, Vaseline & Robijn) geven ons een unieke kans om positieve verandering te creëren, ons bedrijf te laten groeien en ons doel te bereiken om een duurzaam leven mogelijk te maken.
Op 3 mei van 13.30 tot 17.30 uur organiseren we een Internship Exploration Day om je mee te nemen in ons Unilever-stageprogramma in Nederland. Ons stageprogramma is ontworpen om een leerervaring te creëren door je een uitdagende en doelgerichte kans te bieden waarmee je je carrière een kickstart kunt geven!
Hoe ziet de Internship Exploration Day eruit?
Eerst verwelkomen we je op onze Hofplein kantoor in Rotterdam. Peter Dekkers, hoofd van Unilever Netherland, zal je meenemen door zijn reis in Unilever en je laten zien dat Unilever de plek is waar je je purpose tot leven kunt brengen met het werk dat je kunt doen. Daarnaast werkt ons Talent Advisory team samen met jou aan je eigen personal brand pitch. Dit zal te pas komen wanneer je Unilever medewerkers in jouw interessegebied ontmoet! We sluiten de dag af met wat fun.
Alles over jouJe bent beschikbaar om fysiek naar kantoor te komen voor onze Internship Exploration Day op 3 mei.Je hebt interesse in een stage in Marketing, Customer Development of Supply Chain.Beschikbaarheid voor 5 tot 6 maanden vanaf september 2023, minimaal 32 uur per week.Je bent ingeschreven aan een hogeschool (3e of 4e-jaars) of universiteit tussen september 2023 en februari 2024Engelse taal is vereist, Nederlandse taal heeft voorkeur voor Marketing en Supply Chain, maar is vereist voor Customer Development
Enthousiast?
Meld je dan nu aan door je CV en motivatiebrief te uploaden! Op 24 april laten we je weten of je geselecteerd bent en uitgenodigd wordt voor de Internship Exploration Day. Dit evenement is ter oriëntatie en zou je een voorzetje kunnen geven in onze sollicitatieprocedure.
Voor vragen kun je ons hier bereiken:
recruitment-benelux@unilever.com
Disclaimer
Unilever is een gelijke kansen werkgever. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten zullen in aanmerking komen voor een baan zonder rekening te houden met ras, huidskleur, religie, geslacht, seksuele geaardheid, genderidentiteit, genderexpressie, nationale afkomst of enige andere basis die wordt beschermd door de toepasselijke wetgeving, en zullen niet worden gediscrimineerd op basis van handicap.
ENGLISH
Unilever's Internship Exploration Day: Kickstart your career!
Are you interested in an Internship in Marketing, Supply Chain or Customer Development at Unilever? And do you want to start your internship journey end of August/beginning of September? Then this is the event for you!
A better business. A better world. A better you.
Unilever is a global Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) company with over 400 brands powered by 168.000 employees that operates in more than 190 countries, with a 60 billion turnover. Our brands (such as Ben & Jerry’s, Knorr, Dove, Vaseline & Robijn) give us a unique opportunity to create positive change, to grow our business, and to achieve our purpose of making sustainable living commonplace.
We are hosting an Internship Exploration Day on the 3rd of May from 13:30 till 17:30 to take you through our Unilever Internship Programme in the Netherlands. Our Internship programme is designed to create a learning experience by providing a challenging and purposeful opportunity that allows you to kick-start your career!
What does the Internship Exploration Day look like?
First, we will welcome you at our office in Rotterdam. Peter Dekkers, Head of Unilever Netherlands, will take you through their Unilever journey and will show you that Unilever is the place where you can bring your purpose to life with the work that you can do. Next to this, our Talent Advisory team will work with you on creating your very own personal brand pitch. This will come in handy when you meet Unilever employees in your area of interest! We will close off the day with some fun.
All about you
You are available to physically come to the office for our Internship Exploration Day on the 3rd of May
You have an interest in starting your Internship journey in Marketing, Customer Development or Supply Chain
Availability of 5 to 6 months from September 2023, minimum of 32 hours per week
You are enrolled at a university of applied sciences (3rd or 4th year) or university between September 2023 and February 2024
English language is required, Dutch language is preferred for Marketing and Supply Chain, but is required for Customer Development
Excited?
Sign up now by uploading your CV and motivation letter! On the 24th of April, we will let you know whether you are selected and will be invited for the Internship Exploration Day. This event is for orientation and could give you a head start within our application process.
If you have any questions, you can reach us here:
recruitment-benelux@unilever.com
Disclaimer
Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Location: Beuningen
Country: Netherlands
Application due date: 2023-04-15

SSABs upcoming fossil-free technology is the first true steelmaking transformation for centuries! Our customers around the world will get premium high-strength steel, adapted to the future. Our Special Steels Sales division in Beuningen, Netherlands - are looking for a new INDOOR SALES PERSON. Please come and be a part of our journey and our team!
As an Indoor Sales person in our Special Steels Sales department you will be a part of a group of 7 persons and work closely to the Regional Sales Managers and our customers in the Benelux region.

We offer

The chance to learn more about premium high-strength steel, stock sales, customer service and become a part of our SSAB family
Work in a developing, exciting and fast pace industry
Opportunity to work partly remotely
Be a part of a great team that will support you from day one

More about the job
General tasks such as order registration and monitoring, bookings, sending offers, follow-ups and additional sales. You will cooperate with our logistics, technical support and central Customer Care department at our mills in Sweden and Finland. You will have an important role in terms of being our costumers’ first contact and we want to make sure we provide the best service.

Selection of tasks

Answer to inquiries; check stock balance and get back to costumer with offers.
Follow-up the offers
Controlling the changes in our systems SAP, MAS and JEVES.
Give correct price based on updated price lists, agreements, following instructions given by RSM and ASM.
Work with our local stock keepers
Register complaints, inform Regional Sales Managers/Area Sales Managers about any deviations

Who You Are

You enjoy working with a mix of administrative tasks, customer service and sales
You are comfortable with handling different computer systems, also under time pressure
Motivated and solution oriented
Organized and structured
Service minded and communicative, not afraid to contact any costumer or answer the phone
A team player
Fluent Dutch and working English knowledge is required
Knowledge in French language is a plus

Recruitment Process

Apply
Answer prerecorded questions
Meet SSAB – digital interview
In-person Interview
Sign!
Onboarding

Application
Send your application no later than April 15th 2023. Screening and contact starts directly, so don´t wait too long to send your application.

Contact info: Gustaf Wahlström, Area Sales Manager, SSAB Special Steels, Netherlands, Tel: + 31 612590298

Background check may be a part of the recruitment process.

We decline contacts from recruitment agencies and ad sellers regarding this advertisement.

Introduction to the job
The BPM team is the owner of the manage business process capability and as such is responsible for supporting business process owners in designing, managing and improving their business processes so that business objectives can be achieved in an effective and efficient manner across Sectors.
One of the sectors that the BPM team supports, is Business Performance Improvement (BPI). This sector supports ASML in improving its cross-sectoral non-product related processes to help it deal with growth in scope, volume and complexity and to bring value to our employees and customers alike.
Outside BPI, the BPM team also supports various other strategic breakthrough programs, that enable both functional Sectors and product Business Lines to improve their way of working and to increase quality levels to create customer trust. Since its recent move back to Global Quality, the BPM team is starting to play its role in helping ASML adopt a Quality First mindset, by addressing quality issues from an end-to-end perspective and coming up with sustainable solutions.
To help ASML achieve the full business benefits of BPM, it is essential that the ARIS BPM application can be easily found and used by all ASML employees, from Global Process Owners to newly hired engineers who want to find work instructions that explain in simple day to day language how things are done at ASML. Our motto is: “Three clicks does it all”. Achieving this motto requires a significant step-up in the current configuration of ARIS, as well as ongoing improvements going forward.
Job Mission
As a Process Consultant within the Global ASML Business Process Management (BPM) team you will support ASMLBusiness Process Owners (BPO’s) in designing, managing and improving their End to End processes based on the ASML BPM approach. In doing so, you will act as a Change ambassador for both BPM and End to End process thinking.
You will plan, run and report-out on process (re)design workshops using the Process Excellence (PEX) Methodology, for process (re)design projects This requires close collaboration and active stakeholder management of BPO’s and Business Subject Matter Experts (SME’s) and Discipline Leads in areas such as Global Quality, Risk & Business Advisory and the Chief Data Office.
Given that both process ownership and process maturity levels vary across the organization, you will be required to tailor the PEX methodology to your projects to ensure the approach agreed with your key stakeholders meets business requirements as well as the required quality standards.
You will work closely with the other BPM team members, i.e. Process Architects, Process Consultants, Process Modelers, Project Management and the ARIS Backoffice team to ensure the processes designed fit within the ASML Business Process Framework and are documented and maintained properly in ARIS.
Role and responsibilities
Deliver process (re)design projects within agreed scope and time based on the PEX methodology
Prepare, conduct, facilitate and report out on process (re)design workshops
Pro-actively engage and partner with project stakeholders (BPO’s & SME’s) to ensure ownership and business relevance
Ensure timely and proper involvement of relevant Discipline Leads in process (re)design projects, such as Global Quality, Risk & Business Advisory and the Chief Data Office.
Ensure timely and proper involvement of BPM Process Architects, Process Modelers and the BPM Backoffice in process (re)design projects
Ensure process owner sign-off and quality assurance of the agreed project deliverables via the Process Review Board
Education and experience
Education
Master degree (preferably in Business Administration or Industrial Engineering)
Experience
5 to 10 years of process design and improvement experience, preferably as an internal or external consultant
within a corporate environment
Experience with ARIS business process analysis & management software desirable
Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:
Hands on, can do mentality
Able to deal with fast changing environment and scope
Conceptual thinking, problem solving and constructive challenging abilities
Strong Project Management, Facilitation, Communication & Stakeholder Management skills
Team player
Able to live the ASML core values: Collaborate, Challenge & Care
Fluent in English (essential) and Dutch (desirable)
Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.
Other information
Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.

At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential — your ability to learn, grow, and contribute in meaningful ways. We believe in the power of great people working together to innovate and solve problems no one could solve alone. We build enduring partnerships with our customers and take on their challenges and opportunities as our own.

Your Impact

As an Accountant you play an important part of the ASP European Accounting function. You will be part of a dynamic and growing team responsible for the financial accounting and reporting of multiple legal entities in EMEA. This includes ensuring a timely and accurate monthly close, preparation of the annual statutory accounts and supporting the US GAAP and Statutory audits.

Under general direction and in accordance with all applicable government laws, regulations and ASP policies, procedures and guidelines, this position:

Responsible for the timely preparation of US GAAP and local statutory financial statements of the assigned legal entities.
Responsible for the monthly closing process for the) including but not limited to: .

Standard and non-standard monthly journal postings and GL reconciliations
Monthly Intercompany invoices and reconciliation of month end balances with regions
Fixed asset postings and reconciliations
Month end accruals review and posting
Preparation of key reserves for review with regional controllers
Prepare monthly Intercompany invoices and reconcile month end balances with regions.
Daily bank postings and reconciliations ensuring all payments have the correct sign off in line with policy

Control and maintain monthly balance sheet reconciliations and balance sheet reviews with management and internal/external auditors
Coordinates Internal and external audits for assigned legal entities.
Preparation of local statutory Financial Statements.
Manage the preparation of ASC 740 tax reporting for the assigned entity and ensure timely filing of local corporate income tax returns in conjunction with the Fortive Corporate Tax Department;
Coordinate & execute on the effective preparations of VAT returns and maintain/improve VAT compliance processes for the assigned entities.
Drive efficiencies and process improvements, ensuring compliance with company policy & procedures, local and US GAAP requirements
Adhoc duties as required.
Responsible for communicating business related issues or opportunities to next management level
Performs other duties assigned as needed

Minimum of 2 years of progressive experience in finance and accounting within an international / US organization
Excellent working knowledge of US GAAP and local statutory/tax regulations and in-depth experience on compliance and accounting requirements across multi EMEA jurisdictions. Experience with local GAAP and IFRS is considered a plus
A ‘hands on’ work style, comfortable with the detail, and able to move seamlessly between tactical and strategic issues as required.
Proficiency with ERP system(s) (SAP preferred) and Microsoft Office with solid Excel skills and experience with Hyperion
Ability to meet tight deadlines, handle a demanding and fluctuating workload and at the same time provide accurate and reliable data.
Demonstrated thoroughness and attention to detail with a steadiness under pressure.
Solid communication and presentation skills
Confident, enthusiastic and a team player
Fluent in English (other EU languages is a plus - Spanish preferred but not essential)

We welcome candidates with disabilities . Fortive is a global family of more than 20 industry-leading industrial growth and technology companies, united by a shared purpose: to make the world stronger, safer, and more effective by providing essential technology for the people who accelerate progress. Here, you get the excitement of a “startup” with the stability and predictability of an organization strongly grounded in its roots and with a proven track record of growth. There’s no limit to what you can learn, or the impact you can make: for you, for us, for growth. Come join our team at Advanced Sterilization Products (ASP) and be part of a global leader in infection prevention solutions for the healthcare industry. With advanced products, technologies, and workflows for medical sterilization and disinfection, ASP is dedicated to defending the lives of patients, families, healthcare workers, providers, and communities. Add your talent to our extraordinary team and help us in our mission to make healthcare safer for everyone. ASP is based in Irvine, California with core sites in Everett, Washington and Schaffhausen, Switzerland plus many more offices around the world.

Mar 12, 2023
PC Deurne, NL
What are we looking for
The National A&D Sales Manager Benelux works closely with the Director of Europe A&D Sales to ensure that all distribution centers are in sync with current initiatives and sales trends.

What you will do
Focus on Sales goals across all centers and at the Nacional level within the Architects Segment. Prepare, present and defend quotations for projects specified by Interior designers.Support the Architect & Designer Sales Managers across Benelux. Attend weekly/quarterly meetings and calls with local and national team members in order to generate new ideas, share market information, and report your own activity, challenges, and successes.Perform site visits and ride-along with Architect & Designer Sales Managers in target markets. Work with CBU and other relevant parties and departments to create specific objectives and goals for each market as needed.
- Manage the effectiveness of the APB channel objectives and communicate on a monthly basis with each General Manager regarding WE; CTOP, relationships sales, and, key accounts. - Focus on Sales goals across all centers and at the Nacional level within the Architects Segment. Prepare, present and defend quotations for projects specified by Interior designers.
Support the Architect & Designer Sales Managers across Benelux. Attend weekly/quarterly meetings and calls with local and national team members in order to generate new ideas, share market information, and report your own activity, challenges, and successes.Perform site visits and ride-along with Architect & Designer Sales Managers in target markets. Work with CBU and other relevant parties and departments to create specific objectives and goals for each market as needed.Manage the effectiveness of the APB channel objectives and communicate on a monthly basis with each General Manager regarding WE; CTOP, relationships sales, and, key accounts.Increase Brand recognition within the design community in Benelux. Assist in conceptualizing and organizing relevant customer events, forums, and focus groups. Actively participate in local industry affiliations and associations regularly and provide recaps of each event attended.Conduct training and product knowledge sessions both remotely and at the Cosentino City Centers in order to keep customers up to date on new product offerings and company programs.Focus on top designers per center and develop strong relationships with them that will return in SALES opportunities.Grow the B2C program within the design industry across Germany.Grow the WE-CTOP platform sign-ups and execution of the Loyalty programs in the AD segment.Open opportunities with the different applications and new business sectors that directly co-relate with the Architect & Interior Design Industry.Work closely with the Marketing team for all merchandising activities.Manage the day-to-day of the Loyalty Program and Digital platform.Work and collaborate with the Salesforce development team in order to optimize Salesforce performance in the Architect & Design Segment.

What you need to succeed

Knowledge
Proficient in running webinars and conference call services such as Teams, GoTo Webinar, and others.
Experience in Salesforce.
Project Management knowledge.
English (C1); any other language will be highly appreciated.

Skills:
Excellent communication skills.
Excellent analytical skills.
Ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Exceptional written and oral communication skills.

Others:
Location: Any location in Benelux.
Ability to travel up to 80% of the time.

What we do offer
This is a great opportunity to help our community of Architect & Designer Sales Managers to continue growing in their sales indicators, good orientation to the “key client” and consolidate this sales role within our organization.

About Cosentino

At COSENTINO, our purpose is to inspire People through innovative and sustainable spaces. We are the world-leading producer of architectural and decorative surfaces. Our products are designed to provide innovative and functional solutions for either home and business spaces, such as Kitchen and Baths worktops, outdoor open spaces, facades, etc. Innovation, sustainability, functionality and beauty describe our value proposition to the different market stakeholders and end Clients. www.cosentino.com

With a presence in more than 100 Countries and 5 continents, our business keeps growing consistently in all geographies. as well as career opportunities for Talented people like you.

Cosentino is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Cosentino is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Cosentino are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.


Cosentino will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.”

Job Segment: Marketing Manager, Sales Management, Interior Designer, Merchandising, Manager, Marketing, Sales, Creative, Retail, Management

Overview:

The primary purpose of this position is to serve Cook patients while increasing the sales and profitability of the Specialty in the assigned territory. This should be achieved by implementing local sales and marketing strategies which have been agreed with the Regional Manager and are in support of the goals and general strategies of the Specialty. The Sales Representative must develop a thorough knowledge and understanding of the products and their associated clinical areas of use.
Responsibilities:
Meet or exceed the sales targets set by Specialty Management by working independently in assigned territory to present and sell products and services to physicians, hospitals, outpatient facilities, health care facilities, purchasing organizations, purchasing groups, multi-hospital systems, health care provider alliances, and other key decision makers
Demonstrate an excellent knowledge of the product range of the Specialty and a sound understanding of the associated medical discipline.
Provide proficient technical training and support to medical personnel on the use of Cook’s medical devices as required.
Territory budget management for local in field events and sample stock.
Develop and maintain an annual business plan which includes but is not limited to the following:
anticipated sales increases
risk management
sales opportunities
anticipated competitive activity
contingency plans
Follow-through on customer requests and commitments
Monitor and increase market share and competitor activity in the assigned territory.
Participate in local and international exhibitions and meetings as requested.
Identify, establish and develop relationships with key clinical and non-clinical decision-makers
Work closely and effectively with the other members of the sales team and with Cook support functions in order to provide the best possible service to the customer and the patient.
Work closely and effectively with members of Cook’s Commercial and Business Care Integration teams to develop contractual opportunities with customers and maximize the service provided to the customer and patient.
Seek and evaluate new product ideas, providing adequate information and facilitate ongoing communication. Assist in product evaluations and/or clinical studies as appropriate.
Understand and follow Cook quality policies and procedures with respect to Complaint Handling, Product Returns, Samples, Consignment Stock and any other areas as appropriate.
Compliance with, and accountability for all policies within the Cook Employee Handbooks, Cook Code of Conduct, Policy and Guidance on Interaction with Healthcare Professionals, Cook’s Privacy Regulations, and all other applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations. Employee is further required to sign and comply with Cook’s Confidentiality and Non-Competition Agreements
Qualifications:
Ability to meet frequently with customers and other decision makers.
Ability to travel frequently throughout assigned territory.
Previous medical sales experience preferred.
Product or Procedural knowledge an advantage.
Good communication and inter-personal skills.
Language Skills - good written and verbal command of English and other relevant languages.
Excellent numeric skills.
Good working knowledge of Microsoft® Office.
Proven problem-solving skills.
Excellent organizational skills.
High self-motivation.

job_titles: Internship in Parameterized Light Recipe Engine (m/f/d)
job_description:
Job Title
Internship in Parameterized Light Recipe Engine (m/f/d)
Job Description
We’re looking for an Intern (m/f/d) to join our Innovation Team in Eindhoven.
During this assignment you will be part of the NatureConnect Venture team. NatureConnect is Signify’s latest lighting innovation on humans Health & Wellbeing. It brings the benefits of natural light indoors for comfortable, engaging and attractive environments. Next to the NatureConnect team, you will also be working with colleagues from Design and Research departments.
Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry. As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more! Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.
We define the meaning of light…join us to #findyourmeaning @ Signify!
Being in early phase of sales growth, the NatureConnect Venture is interested to further develop knowledge and innovation with respect to certain functionalities related to connection with nature, accelerating the innovation. Your assignment will be to develop new algorithms for dynamic light recipes. These new algorithms should allow for more advanced functionality and in the future will replace the current algorithms that have several limitations.
Are you the enthusiastic, talented intern that we are looking for?
What you’ll do
Understand the NatureConnect light recipes, how it is implemented, and its limitations
Define the requirements for the new algorithm
Develop the new algorithm
Build a functional prototype in a high-level programming language (e.g,. Python), compatible with existing interfaces
Develop a proposal on how to integrate the new algorithm in the actual product architecture
Documentation and presentation of your results
Your qualifications
Interested in working on Software and Algorithms
Bachelor or Master student in Software Engineering or similar, preferably in the last year of your study
Experience with Python, C
Hands-on, self-starter, able to create and build prototypes
A fast learner: Passionate about learning and assessing how to apply your theoretical knowledge in a dynamic, innovative, and fast paced environment.
Interest in Lighting and Biophilic design
Our candidate profile is just a guide. We know that many talented people only apply for jobs when there is an exact match. If you don't fit all the criteria but believe this role is for you, we would very much like to hear from you.
What you’ll get in return
We’re offering an open culture, possibility to learn about lighting at world leader Signify, possibility to create impactful value for innovative market propositions, strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.
Notes
EU/EER students: In order to be considered for this internship, you need to be registered as a student during the entire internship period. Formal documentation of this may be requested at any time.
Non-EU students in Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and your university needs to sign the Nuffic Agreement. The internship needs to be a compulsory part of your studies (receive ECTS in turn). In case of non-compulsory internship, you need to have a letter from the university in which it states that your internship contributes to your personal development, what your learning goals are and what tasks you will undertake during your internship. The letter has to be signed and stamped by your university.
Non-EU students in non-Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and the internship should be a compulsory part of your studies. Also, you need to be able to get the official approval of your university for this internship (Nuffic agreement).
Please apply only if you can meet the aforementioned requirements.

Location:
Rotterdam, NL, 3013 AA
Req ID: 82127
Facility: Rotterdam-548
Department: Segment Controlling PO&D
Division: Intermediates and Derivatives, Refining
Are you attracted to work at one of the most advanced chemical production companies of the world? Welcome to LyondellBasell…
This is LyondellBasell

As a leader in the global chemical industry, LyondellBasell strives every day to be the safest, best operated and most valued company in our industry. The company’s products, materials and technologies are advancing sustainable solutions for food safety, access to clean water, healthcare and fuel efficiency in more than 100 international markets. LyondellBasell places high priority on diversity, equity and inclusion and is Advancing Good with an emphasis on our planet, the communities where we operate and our future workforce. The company takes great pride in its world-class technology and customer focus. LyondellBasell has stepped up its circularity and climate ambitions and actions to address the global challenges of plastic waste and decarbonization. For more information, please visit www.lyondellbasell.com or follow @LyondellBasell on LinkedIn.
This is the role

The Lead Business Finance Analyst is a key role in the Intermediates and Derivatives (I&D) segment controlling team and reports to the Senior Manager Business Finance PO&D and Segment Reporting.
This position provides accurate financial analysis and insights, consolidation, forecasting and reporting for the global PG & ethanol businesses in the Propylene Oxide & Derivatives (PO&D) award unit. In addition to the PG, IPA & ethanol responsibilities, this role will also provide support to the Senior Manager Business Finance PO&D regarding the consolidation & reporting activities of the total I&D segment by creating and reviewing the monthly I&D business review deck (BRM) and quarterly segment analysis as well as by supporting the monthly I&D working capital forecasting process.
This position engages with the PO&D Business Directors and Marketing Managers as required during the forecasting and reporting cycle. This position also requires close interaction and collaboration with the business analyst group, the Director Business Finance I&D & other finance, business & operations stakeholders. In addition, this Lead Business Finance Analyst role is a participant of the PO&D Sales & Operational Planning and Manufacturing meetings.
The successful candidate will be considered as an expert in the use and operation of the company's financial systems. This role will also act as focal point for General Ledger/SAP accounting issues as they relate to properly assigning costs and revenues to cost centers and profit centers, and provides guidance to members of the Finance department often through the process of coordinating a joint work product.

Responsibilities:
Coordinate the monthly forecast process and provide information to determine if any actions should be taken to ensure delivery of the annual plan.
Evaluate the business income statement and balance sheet as part of the monthly close process to monitor data integrity and investigate any significant variance.
Provide variance analysis of business results versus targets for appropriate periods; assist with preparation of short, medium and long-term profitability forecasts.
Support preparation of internal financial analysis for PO&D business management.
Prepare and present financial results at quarterly Business, Operational Planning and Manufacturing team meetings.
Provides PO&D related input for the quarterly business performance flux analysis to the Leadership team and Investor Relations, which is used in external reporting of results in Q and K filings with the SEC. As a result, accuracy and attention to detail are critical success factors.
Support the I&D segment working capital forecast process.
Provide ad hoc special business performance analysis.
Annual budget coordination and preparation, and support the I&D fixed cost responsibility budget process.
Perform financial analysis in compliance with the Sarbanes Oxley 404 Management testing standards. On a quarterly basis, provide a Financial Statement Review representation and sign-off on balance sheet, income statement and statement of cash flow.
Support and participate in other financial initiatives outside of the I&D segment.
This is who you are

You have the ability to work independently and solve non-recurring problems and drive continuous process improvements and exhibit strong analytical, evaluation and problem solving skills. You possess to assert innovation and creativity to improve business and functional processes and reporting whilst adhering to a strong control environment. Paying attention to detail to ensure accounting and financial information is timely, accurate and complete, is your second nature. You outstand in managing conflicting priorities (multiple tasks) and supporting business unit management with sound business and financial counsel while constantly challenging to drive the team to optimize results and add value. Besides you exhibit a strong sense of urgency and accountability.

This is what you bring
BA in a financial/business field or relevant experience with minimum three years of financial or business analysis experience preferred. MBA, CPA, CFA or equivalent experience valued;
Strong analytical, evaluation and judgment skills;
Thorough understanding of financial and manufacturing accounting principles and procedures (US GAAP and IFRS), and financial performance indicators (e.g. margin, ROCE);
Interpersonal skills necessary to work effectively as a team member, and achieve results through the contributions of other people within and outside the immediate organization;
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills;
Advanced PC skills, including spreadsheets, database, graphics, statistical forecasting, and modeling. Expertise in SAP preferred;
Fluency in English is a must and any other language is a plus.
This is what we offer

We offer an environment where we encourage personal and professional growth and where you will be rewarded for your performance and results. You will have the possibility to work with specialist on all fields to develop innovative solutions and to extend your national and international network. In addition, we offer you a competitive salary package. The Company's Global Remote Work Policy allows eligible employees the option to work up to three days a week from home. LyondellBasell is committed to advancing diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) to ensure a positive experience for all employees.

Interested?

Please feel free to contact our sr Corporate Recruiter at natalie.backx-cornelissen @ lyondellbasell.com for more details.
Would you like to apply? Just send us your motivation and resume via the application button. The recruitment process exists of an initial phone screening and two/three business interviews before proceeding to a possible job offer a background check will be part of the process.
 #LI-NB1

To apply to a Varex Imaging position, please create an account and sign-in.
CURRENT VAREX IMAGING EMPLOYEES: Please apply by logging into your internal Workday Account.
Summary
Ensures legal compliance and provides import/export administration and control within government rules and regulations, including appropriate licensing for shipments. Reviews contracts for required clauses and identifies omissions. Interfaces with internal and external customers, foreign order administration, freight forwarders, customs officers and other functional areas to ensure coordination and logistics of shipment. Selects carrier/forwarder for shipment of products and prepares documents for freight forwarders.
Job Description
EMEA Trade Compliance Analyst
Varex Imaging seeks a trade compliance analyst to perform various import and export related functions and activities to ensure efficient and compliant trade operations for Varex Imaging locations both in the Netherlands but also for other entities throughout Europe. The role ensures legal compliance with applicable export and import laws and regulations and provides import/export administration and control within government rules and regulations.
Main responsibilities:
Perform import screening and collect, review, and organize commercial and shipping documents and records for customs clearance.
Provide timely and accurate instructions to customs brokers for clearance into the EU and resolve any clearance delays in a timely matter.
Performs steps necessary to ensure compliant customs clearance including monitoring proper use of HS classifications, valuation, and origin.
Archive import and export documentation including commercial invoices, customs entries, and export declarations.
Communicate and interface with customs authorities, freight forwarders, carriers, port terminals, buyers, logistics/shipping department, and vendors on customs and export matters as needed.
Analyze import/export data to identify risks or opportunities for savings.
Review and process export order holds by analyzing business transactions for export control and other sanctions requirements.
Administer the embargoed country, restricted party screening, and export controlled shipment process.
Support accuracy and help maintain robust global trade compliance data within different ERP’s (Visual Enterprise, SAP and other parts lists databases).
Ensure effective and timely review and assessment of import/export records.
Requirements:
Knowledge on Dutch and correspondingly EU customs and trade regulations.
Solid Dutch and English language (written and spoken) required.
Experience in a customs and global trade environment in a comparable position, preferably in a manufacturing industry or in a consulting company.
Strong computer skills including ability to research transactions and prepare required documentation, perform spreadsheet calculations, and quickly learn new software tools.
Strong verbal and written communication skills and strong organizational skills.
Ability to handle complex details, work calmly under pressure and with frequent interruptions, and display sound judgment.
Effective and flexible team player, with ability to work well with cross-functional departments and teams in multiple countries.
SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND CERTIFICATIONS
Required Certifications and Training
Obtains and completes LMS training plan specific to assigned responsibility.
Experience Level with Business Tools
Proficient in utilizing business tools such as: E-mail, Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Experience with SAP or equivalent ERP product and productivity software desired.
LEVEL DESCRIPTION
Knowledge
Having wide-ranging experience, uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
Job Complexity
Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Exercises independent judgment and discretion in solving complex business problems.
Interaction
Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise.
Supervision
Determines methods and procedures reviewed by others on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other personnel (Team Lead).
Typical Education and Experience
Bachelors degree (or equivalent experience) and 8 years of related experience or Masters Degree with 6 years of related experience.
ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Environment and Physical Demands
As described in the job posting
Ability to Travel
Travel may be required. See the job posting for more information.
Time Type:
Full time
Job Type:
Regular
Work Shift:
N/A
Pay Rate Type:
Salary
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Canon is changing and so are the markets we supply and the customers we serve. We are on a journey of transition to being a truly customer centric company bringing new services and solutions to our customer communities. To support us on this journey our IT Security team provide critical expertise and advice which supports and signs off system development and changes within the organization.
As an Application Security Lead, you will be part of the EMEA Information Security Department team, responsible for secure applications development, and for supporting development teams with knowledge and implementation of security controls. Furthermore the role has a strong input into the organization’s security roadmap for the Application Security domain.

What we give
With Canon, you'll get the support and encouragement you need to grow, from people who share your ambition. We'll invest in your professional development to help you learn and progress in your role with us. You'll find leaders who give you the freedom to explore new things and a team where knowledge is shared openly.
As an Application Security Lead you will:
Act as the security representative within project streams for new and upcoming projects
Work closely with the business and IT stakeholders, and in close cooperation with all the functions in the EMEA Security team
Support project and development teams with relevant security knowledge
Translate security policies into security requirements for new and existing projects
Assist with the implementation of the security design principles
Conduct security architecture and design reviews
Set and validate security criteria for Quality Gate approvals
Recommend and assist in the implementation of security controls in the SDLC of supported applications
Support the planning and execution of application pentests, and the follow-up of remediation measures
Be the interface towards the Canon organization for the various services and capabilities provided by the EMEA Security team (EISD)
What we ask
We are looking for the following in our future colleague:
Significant working experience in a technical capacity in a Security or IT department, preferably across multiple security domains.
Demonstrable working experience in solution design, security assessments, application development and/or application security.
Knowledge and expertise in secure software development (SSDLC) is desirable.
Ability to understand, follow up and progress mitigation activities for security auditing reports, penetration testing reports and/or configuration reviews.
Good stakeholder management and communication skills.
Experience working in large international organizations and in handling large enterprise projects is a plus.
You will need
Best practices of security requirements and controls in software development
Knowledge of Secure Architecture and Design principles, as well as an understanding of Threat Modelling
Secure coding knowledge for common languages and platforms
Knowledge of security frameworks, such as OWASP, NIST CSF, CIS etc.
Understanding of EU and local compliance requirements, such as GDPR, PCI-DSS, SOX etc.
Understanding of vulnerability scanning tools (usage and follow up)
Knowledge of security for cloud and serverless (containers) technologies is big plus
Relevant security degrees and certifications are welcome, but not required.

Further Information
In addition to a competitive salary, you will be eligible for the following benefits in this role:
Performance-based bonus of 12,5%
31 days holiday per year
Pension plan
Bicycle plan
Full coverage of your public transport costs and partially car costs
 Canon champions hybrid working with and a flexible working policy. You will be part of an energetic and innovative environment with more than 50 different nationalities! Lastly you’ll find that Canon encourages continuous Learning and Development with a wide range of resources and support available on demand.
Does this seem like a great fit for your career expectations? We're excited to hear from you! Even if you don't meet all the qualifications we still encourage you to apply.
This role can be performed from either of our HQ locations in Amstelveen (The Netherlands) or Stockley Park (United Kingdom).

Grade: 14
Job family: IT - Security
Canon is enriching lives and businesses in incredible new ways. You can play a part in shaping the future of a company that’s visionary, innovative and bold. As the world's best imaging company, we're living and working together for the common good.

DEPARTMENT
The NL Controllership organization is responsible for the following:
Ensuring IFRS compliance at all time in all internal and external reporting streams, providing timely and technically sound IFRS analyses and opinions on any relevant IFRS complex matters, demonstrating reasonable assurance and establishing sufficient internal controls over financial reporting;
Preparing the statutory financial statements of several SABIC subsidiaries
JOB PURPOSE & RESPONSIBILITIES
As team member of the NL Controllership team, you will be responsible for preparing the financial statements of a number of legal entities within the SABIC group in compliance with local GAAP.
You need to understand business dynamics and perform in depth analysis of the financials to ensure that the monthly IFRS group numbers are fairly stated before consolidation and various financial processes that apply to your entities. Your role is to identify risk areas for your ledger and make sure you have appropriate controls in place. In addition, Ad hoc projects are also part of your role and you will support any managerial reporting where needed.
Key responsibilities:
Mainly statutory reporting of Dutch legal entities and time-to-time support other countries with their financial statements.
Align & manage the external auditing procedures of the financial statements where applicable and support heavily the quarterly IFRS group audits
Ensure closing and financial reporting for all legal entities in the Netherlands
Perform analysis of SABIC‘s financial performance on legal entity level. Understand sales, costs trends, understand in detail the balance sheet positions. Your assessment of fairly stated is key.
Provide financial advice to management teams of legal entities in respective regions including upfront IFRS advice in business decisions. Address going concern, negative cash issues.
Evaluate material business transactions based on business insights, and provide posting instructions to Global Financial Operations (GFO).
Provide improvement input on reconciliations, prepared by GFO to increase quality and standardization
Manage risk levels by obtaining assurance on B/S and P/L
Ensure compliance of legal entity financial reporting with SABIC accounting principles
Define period-end adjustments for all legal entities in respective regions
Review and approve handling of local regulatory financial reporting requirements
Validate and internally sign off IFRS financial statements/ Local GAAP statements
Effectively interact, where applicable, with external advisors ensuring quality of deliverables and best in class cost profile of the services received;
Engage and manage the relationship with business finance team and leadership to ensure all the necessary regional information is complete, relevant and in line with high quality standard (sell-side);
Actively interact in the audit process (external auditors & internal auditors);
Engage and support the quarterly group audits, interim audit, pre-close audit, hard-close audit, yearend audit, CAP lists and subsequent audit procedures within the entire organization.
General and strategic aspects:
Build and develop an effective relationship with the relevant counterparts inside and outside the corporate finance organization
On an ongoing basis, challenge the current reporting processes status quo to identify improvement opportunities; suggest and support design and implementation of operational improvements that will positively affect upon service and cost performance;
Promote finance teams knowledge with the rest of the Controllership team to improve the quality of reporting by sharing best practices.
MINIMUM EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
Education and background in Finance/Accounting
Ability to work in a diverse, multicultural and hybrid environment
Knowledge of IFRS and Dutch GAAP practice
Proven track record in transaction service processes and best practice is required
Strong communication and analytical thinking.
5 to 7 years of experience in finance department of large company environment
Good knowledge of PowerPoint and Excel proficiency
Accounting statutory requirements (IFRS)
Fluent in written and spoken English; multiple language ability an advantage
Team player
Eagerness to learn
The location for this role can be either of the three- Sittard/ Bergen op Zoom/ Geleen.
FURTHER INFORMATION
Interested in this position?
Please apply online by sending us your CV and motivation letter in English. Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email. For additional questions you can contact: Recruiter miriam.ozdemir@sabic.com
Please be informed that a reference check, an employment verification and E-assessment are part of our recruitment process. A Certificate of Good Conduct can be requested depending on the level of the role in our organization and/or function, allowing us to request depending on local regulations.

Responses from employment agencies will not be considered.
ABOUT SABIC
SABIC is a global diversified chemicals company, headquartered in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. We manufacture on a global scale in the Americas, Europe, Middle East and Asia Pacific, making distinctly different kinds of products: chemicals, commodity and high performance plastics, agri-nutrients and metals. We support our customers by identifying and developing opportunities in key end-use applications such as construction, medical devices, packaging, agri-nutrients, electrical and electronics, transportation and clean energy. Our production in 2020 was 60.8 million metric tons.
We have more than 33,000 employees worldwide and operates in around 50 countries. Fostering innovation and a spirit of ingenuity, we have 9,000+ global patent filings, and significant research resources with innovation hubs in five key geographies – USA, Europe, Middle East, South Asia and North Asia.
In Europe, we have over 6,000 professionals running multiple world-scale production sites and 4 technology and innovation centers. We are present in almost every European country. Major locations within our broad network of innovation, production and marketing are: Teesside (UK), Cartagena (Spain), Gelsenkirchen (Germany), Geleen (the Netherlands), Bergen op Zoom (the Netherlands) and Genk (Belgium).
SABIC is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and as such will not discriminate in its employment practices, including recruiting and hiring practices, based on a person’s race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law.

About SiTime
SiTime Corporation (NASDAQ: SITM) is the market leader in silicon MEMS timing. As the heartbeat of electronics, our programmable timing solutions offer a rich feature set that enables customers to differentiate their products with higher performance, smaller size, lower power, and better reliability. We drive innovation to new levels with our unique culture of creativity, collaboration, risk-taking, and relentless problem-solving. With over 2 billion devices shipped, SiTime is transforming the timing industry. For more information, visit www.sitime.com.
Job Summary
The Senior ASIC Digital Design Engineer will lead and contribute to circuit design for next-generation products. These products have applications ranging from high-performance Networking and Communications Infrastructure to ultra-low power Mobile platforms including wearable devices. It is not necessary to meet all job requirements to be a qualified candidate for the position.
Responsibilities
Development and verification of digital block architectures and RTL design for various functions including control state machine, IO controllers, digital signal processing (DSP), and multiple clock domain interface management
Work with other digital or mixed-signal designers to define specifications for digital blocks and interfaces
Analyze architecture, RTL design for optimal performance, area and power constraints trade-offs
Document detailed block and top -level specifications
Perform block level RTL design and verification using industry leading EDA tools
Lead comprehensive design reviews
Support backend design flow, including RTL synthesis, clock tree synthesis, scan and DFT insertion, place and route, and netlist verification
Collaborate with analog design engineers, CAD, systems engineering, test engineering and applications teams to ensure define optimal DFT, DFM features and achieve rapid silicon bring-up and time to production release
Participate in the bring-up of silicon prototypes
Analyze circuit for failure root cause analysis, investigate anomalous observations in silicon across various conditions, including PVT variations, and propose solutions
Qualifications & Requirements
M.Sc. or Ph.D. with 5 years of experience in Electrical Engineering
Proven track record at each stage of the following:
Digital architecture development and technical feasibility studies
Writing detailed block-level specifications and review documents
Detailed design and simulation of one or more of the following: digital state machines, DSP functions, IO controllers, multiple block interface management including multi-clock domain designs, microcontroller design and implementation, memory and register file controllers
Proficiency with EDA tools and design languages including Verilog, VHDL, SystemVerilog
Extensive experience in digital block verification strategies
Understanding of digital design flow from architecture design to sign-off
Experience with DSP concepts, circuits, architectures, and implementation
Ability to communicate and work effectively with geographically dispersed teams of mixed-signal, digital, layout, and verifications engineers
Ability to work independently and drive solutions to challenging problems
Good understanding of modeling signal processing algorithm using Matlab or Simulink
Experience in performing synthesis, static timing analysis, and netlist verifications
Understanding of digital backend flow for Place & Route (PNR)
Experience in digital DFT flow (stuck-at / TDF scan insertion and ATPG)
Experience in complex finite state machine design
Desired Characteristics & Attributes
Passionate, self-starter with strong commitment to flawless execution
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required
Ability to work well with others in a fast-paced collaborative team environment
SiTime is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We treat each person fairly and we do not tolerate discrimination or harassment against anyone on the basis of any protected characteristics, including race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, pregnancy, political affiliation, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, or marital status or other characteristics protected by law.
SiTime participates in the E-Verify program.

job_titles: Intern Hue Software Developer - Test Framework Developer
job_description:
Job Title
Intern Hue Software Developer - Test Framework Developer
Job Description
Want to work on the world’s leading smart home lighting system? Join the global development team of Philips Hue for an internship in the role of software developer working on improving our software development using code generation for standards-based interfaces.
As an Intern - Test Framework Developer - you’ll be responsible for investigating, defining and implementing methods to reload a test precondition onto our test setup to speed up and simplify test execution for our automated tests. Current implementation has commissioning steps included in the tests to configure the pre-defined configuration needed for each specific test. With this new to be developed approach we will be able to bypass the time-consuming commissioning of the network. If this pre-condition-restore-mechanism is in place, a logical next step we would like you to investigate the possibilities to create such pre-condition with some scripting methods. With this pre-condition-restore you will decrease the test execution time, which heavily helps in making our continuous integration flow faster.
You’ll be part of one of the Hue Bridge development teams and closely work together with the Hue Infrastructure team, responsible for CI/CD and test automation environments within the Hue Connected R&D organization.
Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive while working in a fast-paced company. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career while transforming our industry.
As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!
Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.
We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!
What you’ll do
You’ll investigate and define concepts and implement tools for loading a pre-condition onto our test setup.
You’ll explore abilities of data backup and restore.
During the internship, you will gain knowledge and experience in test automation, test framework architectures, and test configuration data.
You’ll be actively participating in our virtual intern network where you’ll be working on business cases, personal development and building your internal network.
Your qualifications
You are currently studying in the field of Computer Science.
You are in your last year of Bachelor studies.
You have programming experience including OO language like C# .
You have excellent communication skills.
What you’ll get in return…
Internship allowance; the exact amount depends on your situation (also towards rented accommodation or public transportation).
Paid leave on the basis of 1 day per month.
Extensive set of tools to drive your career, such as a personalized learning platform.
Opportunity to purchase products in the staff shop (MyShop) at reduced prices.
Fun activities with the team.
We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.
See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!
What we promise
We’re committed to the continuous development of our employees, using our learning to shape the future of light and create a sustainable future. Join the undisputed leader in the lighting industry and be part of our diverse global team. #WeAreSignify #SignifyLife
Notes
EU/EER students: In order to be considered for this internship, you need to be registered as a student during the entire internship period. Formal documentation of this may be requested at any time.
Non-EU students in Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and your university needs to sign the Nuffic Agreement. The internship needs to be a compulsory part of your studies (receive ECTS in turn). In case of non-compulsory internship, you need to have a letter from the university in which it states that your internship contributes to your personal development, what your learning goals are and what tasks you will undertake during your internship. The letter has to be signed and stamped by your university.
Non-EU students in non-Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and the internship should be a compulsory part of your studies. Also, you need to be able to get the official approval of your university for this internship (Nuffic agreement).
Please apply only if you can meet the aforementioned requirements.

Job Title
Intern Quality Dashboard Automation
Job Description
We’re looking for an Intern – Quality Dashboard Automation to join our Central Quality team in Eindhoven / Amsterdam.
Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning, our commitment to diversity & inclusion, and our flexible work approach, creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.
As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!
Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.
If you are skilled programmer and like to work on different tools to gather vital information and convert it into meaningful metrics that aid management decisions on software aspects as well as quality analysis, this could be a perfect next step to widen your experience by taking up this key activity in maturing software development process within Signify.
As an Intern – Quality Dashboard Automation, you’ll be analyzing tools used in software development process across Signify, capture the vital information and converting them into meaningful metrics and graphical dashboard that can be used by the management.
What you’ll do
Understand the process flows defined in the tools, the data captured, and the reports generated by these tools. The tools include JIRA, SonarQube, TICS Tiobe, Confluence etc.
Understand the metrics that we want to capture in Signify and identify how the required data can be extracted from these tools.
Publish the extracted data, automate the process, and display the final SW Quality KPIs using charts.
Your qualifications
Skilled in programming languages like Python, Java, Java Script etc.
Ability to understand tools like JIRA, SonarQube, Confluence etc.
Analytical skills
Team player & collaborator, aligning well with various stakeholders and teams.
Good communicator and presenter, willing to listen and speak-up.
Fast learner
What you’ll get in return…
Opportunity to learn about Signify, its functions, Way of Working, Tools, Products etc.
Being part of global world-class, high performing and close-knit Engineering and Business Teams that love to have fun.
See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!
Who we are
Signify is the world leader in lighting. We provide professional customers and consumers with quality, energy-efficient LED lighting systems. And our lights, when connected, bring data to devices, apps and people – redefining what light can do and how you use it. Today, our innovations, such as LiFi – internet connectivity through light – and UV-C, solar and horticultural lighting, contribute to a safer, smarter, more sustainable world. We’re operating in 74 countries with 37,000 people worldwide.
Notes
EU/EER students: In order to be considered for this internship, you need to be registered as a student during the entire internship period. Formal documentation of this may be requested at any time.
Non-EU students in Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and your university needs to sign the Nuffic Agreement. The internship needs to be a compulsory part of your studies (receive ECTS in turn). In case of non-compulsory internship, you need to have a letter from the university in which it states that your internship contributes to your personal development, what your learning goals are and what tasks you will undertake during your internship. The letter has to be signed and stamped by your university.
Non-EU students in non-Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and the internship should be a compulsory part of your studies. Also, you need to be able to get the official approval of your university for this internship (Nuffic agreement).
Please apply only if you can meet the aforementioned requirements
